explanation: Funds are required to accelerate production of small, unmanned surface vehicles to meet an ideal delivery date of August 2025, and to address cost increases above the FY 2025 President’s Budget request of $220 million for the production of Small unmanned surface vehicles. Additional classified details will be provided under separate cover. This funding will procure 116 of the originally planned 300 vehicles. The contract is ready to be awarded as soon as funds are received to sustain an accelerated rate of production. This need is to support efforts of a classified battle plan congruent with Navy missions to - combat a high priority threat. This is a new start. The total cost of this requirement is $354.854 million, and the remaining $220.0 million is requested in the FY 2025 President’s Budget. This is a congressional special interest item.

Funds are available due to the cancellation of the FY 2024 procurement lot. Low Rate Initial Procurement (LRIP) 3 (FY 2023) procurement contract award was delayed until November 2023, and this delayed the LRIP 4 (originally planned FY 2024) production contract award into FY 2025. The FY 2023 and FY 2024 contract awards with the establishment of Advanced Procurement, supporting FY 2025 contract award, would result in three procurement lots delivering at the same time. To smooth out the production line, FY 2024 production was cancelled, and LRIP 4 will be funded with FY 2025 funding. The remaining $58.658 million is required by the program for engineering change orders, production engineering support, and production facilitization to respond to technical issues, production challenges, and address obsolescence issues inherited from AARGM, to maintain sufficient hardware quantities to support procurement through FY 2026. This is a congressional special interest item.
